A story about love and life

editorialNotes.short: Game 7. An intimate and emotional love story.
editorialNotes.tagline: Game 7. An intimate and emotional love story.

editorialNotes.standard: After a long day at work, its bath time! But Swampys shower is broken and he needs your help to guide the water to him. Navigate a path through the dirt past contraptions and obstacles to get every drop to fill the bath.

name: Ticket to Ride The Board Game

editorialNotes.standard: With no time limit, youre free to relax and fully explore every level in this hidden object game and discover all the secrets, like tapping on a snake to pop a chicken out of its mouth.
editorialNotes.short: Search for hidden people and objects in detailed, hand-drawn landscapes.

ios.subtitle: Roll the ball from cat to cat

editorialNotes.standard: Zipping down snowy hills, trying to stay ahead of a massive avalanchethe pressures always on in this infinite-racing classic. And we love that whirlwind pace, fuelled by landing backflips and hitching rides on penguins, snowmobiles and yetis. From the games masterful one-touch controls to its cheery music, every aspect feels perfectly tuned to keep you playing through long afternoons and late nights.

You might get stuck the first time you play Gorogoa. But once the gears of your brain settle into the right configurations, youll see how smart this mix of art and perspective really is. Layers pile upon layers, doors transport you between realities, strange creatures and wild environments blend together into a fascinating interactive collage youll want to peel apart to discover what lies underneath.

editorialNotes.short: Game 14. Explore an ancient, mysterious world.
editorialNotes.tagline: Game 14. Explore an ancient, mysterious world.

ios.subtitle: A puzzle that makes a splash

name: Ice Hockey PRO: game for watch
THE GAME OF LIFE: Road Trip

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Three reasons you must playor replayLucasArts classic adventure: (1) The time-jumping story and quirky characters are as entertaining as ever. (2) So many clever puzzles and funny gags. (3) With beautifully updated graphics and sound, a slick new control scheme and developer commentary, this remaster was clearly a labour of love.

name: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?

ios.subtitle: Play the Official TV Game Show

editorialNotes.standard: Ski Safari returns with an all-new look and the same addictive gameplay. Now you can hit the slopes as Sven's sister, Evana, boot up with a snowboard and unlock all sorts of new power-ups. To outrun an impending avalanche youll need to crash through cabins, team up with Yetis and eagles and perform tons of tricks. The gameplay is as fast-paced as ever, and a fresh multiplayer mode and colourful new worlds to explore (like a prehistoric volcano) will keep you cruising down these mountains for a long time.
editorialNotes.short: Hit the slopes and outrun the avalanche.

ios.subtitle: Adopt a family in your pocket!
New Style of Air Hockey game.

editorialNotes.standard: Ancient Egyptians loved cats, Metallica hasnt played the Super Bowl, and the Ganges is Indias largest riverall our useless knowledge is now coming in handy thanks to Trivia Crack. This bite-sized trivia game is totally irresistible, whether were dominating our Facebook friends in classic mode, trouncing strangers in the 12-question challenge mode, or just sneaking in a game on our Apple Watch. With its cute characters, heaps of unlockable achievements, and a massive variety of questions, we simply cant get enough.

name: Dissembler
artistName: Shape Shop Pty Ltd atf Shape Shop Trust

ios.subtitle: The drawing game for Apple TV!

editorialNotes.tagline: Show off your drawing skills on Apple TV

ios.subtitle: Read a word, find the item!

name: Pull the Pin Ball Puzzle Game

editorialNotes.standard: If you can doodle, you can play this one-of-a-kind Apple Design Award winner. Just draw a lineany lineand watch it spring to life across the screen, following your gestures to collect coloured dots and avoid black holes. But as the holes form increasingly elaborate obstacles, only the most ingenious doodles will do. With endless solutions to every challenge, its a stylish, supremely satisfying test of your creativity and puzzle-solving prowess.

editorialNotes.tagline: Now with an infinite game mode
editorialNotes.standard: At a glance, hocus doesnt look very complicated. You swipe to move a red cube along a latticework of plain grey beams. But dont let the minimalist visuals fool youthe games intelligent, abstract puzzles force you to look at things in a new way, like a cubist translation of Monument Valley. As you progress, the levels quickly get complex. But the peaceful music and crisp design make spending time in its world a richly rewarding experience.

A rare kind of triumph, Prune takes a simple ideapruning treesand shapes it into a creative, deeply playable puzzle game. The visuals echo the style of Japanese painting in striking fashion, and the beautiful music instills a contemplative tone as you swipe to trim the limbs of a rapidly growing tree and guide it around obstacles. Theres no frantic pace, no demanding skills to masteronly a quietly bewitching and unforgettable experience.
editorialNotes.short: A contemplative and creative experience - trimming trees has never been so beautiful.
Get married, raise some kids - but don't give away that you're an octopus.

editorialNotes.standard: What secrets lie in the shadows of this Apple Design Awardwinning puzzler? By twisting and turning unfathomable objects, you cast shadows on beautifully rendered backgrounds; manipulate them just right and youll find shapes youd never have expectedfrom rabbits to wrenches. Soothing ambient music and thematic backdrops make completing each challenge as much meditation as entertainmentwhile timers and achievements give each level a competitive feel.
editorialNotes.short: With stunning visuals and satisfying solutions, this game is one to savour.

editorialNotes.standard: This absorbing puzzler is so minimalist theres no start screen, no logos, no instructionsit just begins. We quickly got lost in the challenge of rearranging tiles, Rubiks Cubestyle, so a single line runs through each pattern. Our advice: sort out the corners and other unique tiles first, then the rest will snap quickly into place.
